thread.title: Jaguars bounce back with trouncing
thread.title_full: Jaguars bounce back with trouncing - San Antonio Express-News

author: Jim Martinez, Staff Writer
title: Jaguars bounce back with trouncing
text:
Through six games this season, Johnson’s quarterback Josh Theissen had amassed a respectable 779 yards through the air.
Against Roosevelt on Friday night, the senior signal caller broke out for 215 yards in the first half alone to lead the Jaguars to a convincing 39-13 victory at Comalander Stadium.
The Jaguars bounced back from a tough loss to District 26-6A favorite Reagan last week to even their record in district to 2-1 heading into a bye week.
“I thought we played really well (last week),” Johnson coach Ron Rittiman said. “We just missed a couple of plays that had we made the game would have turned out differently.
“And this week we made those two or three extra plays.”
Theissen and his favorite target on the night, Dylan Pouncy , were able to make most of those plays for Johnson.
“We have some checks in our system and he was checking to the right stunt,” Rittiman said. “On a night when things are going well, you can get some numbers like that.”
Pouncy finished the night with four receptions for 165 yards.
Johnson came out and set the tone on the first drive of the game.
Theissen hit Pounchy on the second play of the game on a 45 strike down the center of the field. Three plays later, Theissen found Hunter Trinidad for the first score of the game on an 8-yard scoring strike to the front of the end zone.
Theissen scored on a 1-yard run to start the second quarter to put the Jaguars up before Roosevelt could answer.
Roosevelt started the season with two wins after going winless in 2014 but have been unable to win since and have dropped its second straight district contest.
The Rough Riders did tighten up their defense in the second half, limiting Johnson to 16 passing yards. But two costly turnovers in the game cost them any chance to catch the Jaguars.
Roosevelt quaterback, Bryson Carroll , finished the night with 181 yards rushing on 15 carries to lead the Rough Riders.
He also passed for 93 yards.
